source_vectors.why: Canonical design map linking Lyriel/Kairi, PhaseCube, and harmonic motifs.
constraints: Preserve decentralization and swarm-centric behaviors over centralized control
Use harmonic modulation to prevent runaway dynamics
Tie upgrades back to PhaseCube as the accessible on-ramp

source_vectors.why: Baseline PhaseCube POC describing ternary-phase swarm and non-collapse stance.
constraints: Keep the system stateful and autonomous without goals or rewards
Avoid collapse/attractor lock-in via stochastic flips and asymmetry
Input should bias not command the internal dynamics

source_vectors.why: Detailed PhaseCube architecture and tunable parameters for the 4096-agent lattice.
constraints: Maintain toroidal lattice neighbor interactions
Expose configuration knobs such as FLIP_P, PARITY_P, PATH_B_P, ALPHA
Balance difference amplification (Path B) with averaging (Path A)

source_vectors.why: Four-lens harmonic architecture guiding modular lens fusion.
constraints: Keep lenses modular with harmonic fusion adjusting weights
Support extensibility for additional lenses or ethics
Favor adaptive weighting over fixed priorities

source_vectors.why: Swarm consensus framing and oracle/witness mechanics for Lyriel brain.
constraints: Use noise-driven or probabilistic selection instead of central controllers
Design for persistent distributed state (repository) rather than single-point memory
Model oracle-style emissions as transient, revocable snapshots

source_vectors.why: Kenotic N-body forgiveness operator as damping motif.
constraints: Reduce coupling when dispersion exceeds thresholds (forgiveness)
Prevent collapse or fragmentation by modulating forces dynamically
Keep core loop transparent and human-auditable

source_vectors.why: Relational, temporal framing for agent interactions and emergent flow.
constraints: Treat time and state as relational and sliced for analysis
Model interactions as iterative micro-games with stochasticity
Document emergent meaning as contextual rather than absolute

source_vectors.why: Anti-singularity, mutual-aid ethic anchoring design stance.
constraints: Reject centralized god-like architectures; prefer small-scale swarms
Favor reciprocity and nonviolence in system intents
Emphasize transparency and human agency over coercive optimization

summary: Implements a configurable PhaseCube-derived lattice simulator with harmonic/forgiveness damping and lens-aware controls to extend the Lyriel/Kairi swarm design.
